avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last two days as well as the scattered mostly small wind slabs are lying on top of a quite favourable old snowpack.
They can in some places be released by people, especially in pass areas in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, in particular on very steep slopes, caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
As a consequence of solar radiation mostly small dry and moist snow slides are possible, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in steep rocky terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The small quantity of fresh snow and in particular isolated small wind slabs can be released in some cases.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 10 to 25 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last few days above approximately 2000 m. The southeasterly wind has transported the new snow, in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable).
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: The older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. Especially at intermediate and high altitudes these avalanche prone locations are more widespread. They are sometimes covered with new snow and are therefore difficult to recognise, caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are therefore difficult to recognise.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 5 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell in the last few days.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In isolated cases avalanches can be released in deep layers reach medium size on very steep northwest, north and northeast facing slopes. These avalanche prone locations are barely recognisable, even to the trained eye, caution is to be exercised in areas where the snow cover is rather shallow,, this also applies in places that are protected from the wind.
In addition the small wind slabs of Sunday are capable of being triggered in some locations. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, in particular on extremely steep slopes.
As a consequence of solar radiation small dry and moist snow slides are to be expected, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in steep rocky terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on shady slopes at intermediate altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
10 to 15 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell in the last few days above approximately 2000 m. The southeasterly wind has transported the new snow, in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable).
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack. Weak layers exist in the old snowpack especially on shady slopes.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
